snippet: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters....
abstract: Black Republicans express alarm over moralizing and polarizing speeches on issue of race delivered at Republican National Convention, fearing such talk will further alienate minorities from party; speeches, among them talks emphasizing rule of law and denigrating Black Lives Matter movement, are delivered by black and white speakers to largely white audience; 2016 convention has fewer black delegates and speakers than any in two decades.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY, YAMICHE ALCINDOR and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters.

headline.main: Black Republicans See a White Convention, Heavy on Lectures
headline.print_headline: Convention Speeches Unsettle Blacks in G.O.P.
